Class Broker

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • entities.Broker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IEntity, java.lang.Runnable

    public class Broker
extends java.lang.Thread
implements IEntity
    This file contains the code that represents the broker lifecycle.

      • Broker

        public Broker(IStable s,
              IControlCentre cc,
              IBettingCentre bc,
              IRacingTrack rt,
              IPaddock paddock)
        Broker Constructor
        Parameters:
        s - The Stable is a shared memory region where the broker will perform actions.
        cc - The Control Centre is a shared memory region where the broker will perform actions.
        bc - The Betting Centre is a shared memory region where the broker will perform actions.
        rt - The Racing Track is a shared memory region where the broker will perform actions.
        paddock - The Paddock is a shared memory region where the broker will perform actions.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        The run method of the Broker executes its entire life cycle, making the transitions between the states: Opening the event - Announcin next race - Waiting for bets - Supervising the race - Settling accounts - Playing host at the bar. This method runs until it's time to entertain the guests - death state.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread
